alert.note: Alert for Jefferson (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 03 at 1:19PM CST until February 03 at 5:15PM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Louisiana, including the following parishes, Jefferson, St. Charles and St. John The Baptist. * WHEN...Until 430 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 119 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hahnville, Avondale, Metairie, Jefferson, Harahan, St. Rose, Ama, Destrehan, Luling, New Sarpy, Waggaman, River Ridge, Boutte, Norco, Elmwood, Taft, Bridge City, Bayou Gauche, Killona and New Orleans Armstrong Airport. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
